description: This is a well marked, wide, public trail that is part of the Crimson Lake trail from the town of Rocky Mountain House to Crimson Lake.With no elevation change and wide hard packed trail this is an easy hike suitable for children.  Path is well used in winter months and is excellent for snow shoeing.This section of the trail is 4.4km one way, 8.8km return.
directions: To start with this section of the trail system, travel approx 3km West of Rocky Mountain House on Hwy 11.  Trail head is well marked with signage on the North side of the highway, approx 1.5km after crossing the North Saskatchewan River.
title: Twin Lake Trail
